Legal_Issue: Applicability of 'good faith' to sur place claims
Outcome: Claim dismissed initially, decision set aside on judicial review
Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refugee claim determination
Evidence_Type: Testimony, documentary evidence related to sur place activities
Legal_Provision: IRPA sections relating to refugee protection and credibility
Basis_of_Claim: Sur place refugee claim based on post-flight events
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection hearing and subsequent judicial review
Application_Error: Conflating 'good faith' with credibility instead of persecution risk
Review_Outcome: Decision overturned and remanded for redetermination
Assessment_Standard: Objective basis for fear of persecution
Evidence_Ignored: Potential persecution due to claim-related activities in home country
Legal_Standard: Correct legal interpretation of 'good faith' in sur place claims
Application_Factor: Truthfulness under IRPA vs. good faith in sur place context
Decision_Review_Issue: Error of law in applying the concept of 'good faith'
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA - Truthful statements and refugee eligibility
Outcome_of_Review: Remanded to a new panel for reconsideration
Cause_of_Refusal: Legal misinterpretation and improper credibility assessment
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on refugee claims and credibility
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to assess evidence of post-flight persecution risk
Procedural_Fairness: Breach due to incorrect legal framework applied
Credibility_Issues: Incorrect linkage between lack of good faith and credibility
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on error of law in interpretation
Procedural_Issue: Improper application of legal principles during hearing
Omission_Type: Failure to consider persecution risk arising from making the claim
